title: Pack your things
description: Dick Kelty is the inventor of the aluminium frame backpack. Kelty got the idea for his backpack in 1951 when he and a friend were hiking in the Sierra Nevada. Working in his garage, and with $500 borrowed against his house, Kelty and his wife went into production; he cut and welded the aluminium frames, while she stitched the nylon. They sold the finished backpacks for $24 apiece.
completion_text: I have a big challenge for you: try drawing your character behind that backpack! Head, arms, legs…

steps.hint: It's a beautiful day to go for a walk in the forest - **tape** `background blue`
Firstly, set the `stroke` to `0`, to avoid drawing the outlines of the shapes
Déplace-toi the cursor to place the floor - in a new line **tape** `moveTo 0, 250`
Définis the `color` of the grass to `green`
Dessine the floor with a rectangle - **tape** `rectangle 500, 250`
This looks like a nice place for a tree - **tape** `moveTo 220`
Définis the `color` of the trunk to `lightbrown`
Dessine the trunk with a `rectangle` of size `50` by `400`
Beautiful! Now it just needs some leaves - **tape** `move 30, -120` to place them
Définis the `color` of the leaves to `darkgreen`
Dessine a `circle` to represent the leaves with size `200`
Looking great! Let's move the cursor to place our backpack - **tape** `moveTo 150, 200`
Let's choose `color` `brown` for our backpack
Dessine the main part of the rucksack with a square - **tape** `square 200`
Now move the cursor to bottom part of our backpack - **tape** `moveTo 250, 400`
Dessine the bottom using une ellipse - **tape** `ellipse 100, 30`
We need to store the sleeping bag at the top - **tape** `moveTo 250, 200`
Définis the `color` of the sleeping bag to `darkred`
Ready to draw the sleeping bag? Use une ellipse - **tape** `ellipse 115, 40`
We need something to secure your sleeping bag to your backpack - **tape** `moveTo 200, 160`
The `orangered` seems like a nice `color` for the holders
Dessine the left one first - **tape** `rectangle 15, 90`
Position the cursor vers la droite to draw the next holder - **tape** `moveTo 290, 160`
Use a `rectangle` again for the right holder, same as the previous one
Excellent! We need more storage space. Déplace-toi the cursor to the middle - **tape** `moveTo 205, 320`
Use a `rectangle` for the outside pocket, `90` by `60` will suffice
That pocket needs to be closed so bugs can't get in - **tape** `moveTo 250, 320`
Définis the `color` to `lightbrown`
An `ellipse` of size `48` by `7` will help here
Looking great! Let’s place a button on that pocket - **tape** `moveTo 250, 330`
Définis the `color` to `brown`
Dessine a `circle` button of size `10`
